summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for August 7, 2019. It details inmate movements, staffing shortages, and facility operations. The report is significant as it provides a snapshot of the jail's operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death there on August 10, 2019.

keyFacts: This report documents the daily operations of MCC New York on August 7, 2019, just three days before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility on August 10, 2019.
The report notes staffing shortages that led to correctional officer posts being vacated, including posts in the Special Housing Unit and recreation areas.
The facility's control center fire panel was reported as inoperative, indicating a potential security or safety issue.
Multiple inmates were moved into the Special Housing Unit (SHU) pending investigations (SIS) or classification, showing routine inmate management.
The document provides institutional totals, showing 762 inmates were housed at MCC New York at the beginning of the morning watch on August 7, 2019.
